attributes.action: introduce, at the earliest available opportunity, a Bill that will enshrine in law the principle that Members of the House of Commons and the House of Lords must be resident in the UK for tax purposes for the period in which they are Members of either House and that this should be publicly verifiable.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In the UK, there is no taxation without representation. There must be no representatives (elected or unelected) without taxation. Members of Parliament are not ordinary citizens. They can change or make the laws that govern our lives. The party leaders' publicly stated desire to clean up British politics must include steps to ensure that all Members of Parliament pay tax in the country whose laws they make.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
